Education
Master of Applied Science
Major in Electrical Engineering
University of Toronto (U of T)
September 2016 - January 2019

I was part of the Network Architecture group at U of T, under the supervision of Prof. Alberto Leon-Garcia. My research mainly focused of developing a secure autoscaling solution for applications that utilize both microservices and monolithic architectures. My Masters Thesis: Autonomic Management System on SAVI-IoT. Bonus for anyone who finds the Game of Thrones reference in my thesis.

Bachelor of Applied Science
Major in Electrical Engineering
University of Toronto (U of T)
September 2009 - June 2014

I was part of the Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) program at U of T. For the first two years, the curriculum included both Electrical Engineering courses (like Circuit Analysis, Microelectronics, Electromagnetics, etc.) and Computer Engineering courses (C/C++ fundamentals, Computer Hardware and Architecture). For the final two years, I specialized on Communication systems and Computer Networks. I also interned for a year as a Software Developer at a Digital Healthcare Solutions company at Toronto.

Published Research Papers

  • Anomaly Detection using Resource Behaviour Analysis for Autoscaling systems Utilize Auto-regressive statistical techniques for anomaly detection on autoscaling solutions Main Author star
  • Elascale: autoscaling and monitoring as a service Proposed autoscaling solution for both microservices and VMs
  • Monitoring and Measurement in Software-Defined Infrastructure Proposed novel monitoring architecture for cloud infrastructure
